ratings.comment: Bart is very knowledgable and funny. Good: Weekly or twice a week quizzes and no final (imo this is better), encourages participation in discussions. Easy opportunity for 10+% EC with the cyber badger event. Bad: no quiz makeups, he gave us a quiz on the Tues before Thanksgiving, quizzes are harshly graded. He'll call you out for not participating

This class is awful. The professor is condescending, unhelpful, and inflexible. Quizzes are vague, confusing, and the TAs struggle with English, making it hard to get help. Eliza, the sub, is rude and passive-aggressive. Assignments are full of errors like wrong bash commands. Even with a good grade, it's not worth the stress. Avoid it! 0.2/5
Isn't very receptive to feedback or queries on how to better prepare for the course. Weak TA's and no proper grading criteria. Great course material, terrible execution.

Weekly quizzes, participation event and some more extra credit opportunities. Honestly, the 5 page paper wasn't needed for getting extra credit and people say it's easy and sure it's less challenging than the core CS courses but if you miss some of the quizzes and exercises, A would be hard to get. plz don't think this as a general education course
542 is a super fun course. That being said, you may not learn the most from this course. Weekly exams may seem bad but I vastly preferred them to a final. Very easy to get an A in.
Taking this course will cause a nightmare at UW-Madison.

Horrible professor. Rude and inconsiderate. Over half the class stopped showing up towards the end of the semester, unless there was a quiz (you can't make up a quiz if you miss lecture that day!)
When I asked for help because I was sick, he kept giving reasons why it was my fault, and was very resistant to give me any sort of accomodation.

Worst class I ever took in 4 years. First time felt learned nothing TBH.

Always feel being ignored. No one is willing to answer questions as when you say something wrong, Elisa (the other lecturer) will say "no no, that's not right" or alike. Very frustrating.

Even A rate high, please AVOID. Quiz every week and the tough graded.
Worst prof I've ever had in Madison.

Pretty mediocre teaching & lots of rambling on about unrelated things, you won't learn much from him(tho the stories are fun tbh). TA & study group were instrumental to my learning. The material in the class is really good despite his average teaching, so there's plenty of things to learn. LOTS of extra credit opportunities(a complete letter grade

Bart is a nice guy but his fancy CS credentials do not make him a good teacher. He doesn't teach, most of what he says in class is nonsense. He often said "In the real world they don't teach you everything, you have to just figure it out". We're not in the 'real world' yet, we are taking your class to be taught. He's lazy and doesn't explain a lot.

Pretty good professor. I liked his style a lot of explaining stuff and posting the notes to his website so you don't have to take notes. The weekly tests were a pain though because they were at the beginning of the class so any slight delay in getting to class could mean you get less time on the 10 min tests that influence the final grade heavily.

Bart's class was the highlight of my COVID semester. Easily the most expert-taught online class I've ever taken. Technology threw us some curveballs but they were handled easily. Bart's real-world content knowledge and lecture organization made complex concepts easy to understand, and the projects were well chosen. Would recommend to all.

Easily the best professor I have had. Weekly quizzes are easy if you study the challenge problems the night before. Homeworks can be extremely challenging but graded very fairly. He can go off topic in lectures, but it is usually a fun story about what is being discussed. Bart creates a fun class environment and is very passionate about this field.

He is the worst professor. If there is no other professor other than him, I seriously recommend you to take other courses first. You will regret taking his class. Even during the COVID-19 situation, he gives out extremely hard HWs and expects you to do it perfectly. He brings out the devil in you. You will want to curse him (not joking). ThinkAgain

Terrible professor! Wastes time going off on tangents during class and lectures arent concise. Could deliver the same material in less than half the lecture time (read the textbook to save time). Weekly quizzes do not actually help you learn and retain content long term. Programs hardly pertain to class material. Condescending during office hours.

Flipped classroom but he lectures in class and out of class. So basically there are two of the same lectures- the reading is exactly the same as the lecture. So go through the same material 3 times and still do bad on the quizzes because the quizzes are tricky and set up for failure. 15 mins for 4 short answers! Learned nothing-waste of time

Classes are useless. One is better off reading the papers at home. The projects were not related to operating systems and grading was done only on English in our reports. Grade is NOT proportional to efforts put in. The grade is proportional to how well you can write. Felt like we were in technical report writing. Take the class with someone else.

Tough grader. But a very helpful professor. High expectations for the project and there aren't any tests/ quizzes. Class participation is taken seriously. He makes you work hard for the grades, and the result is definitely in proportion to the amount of effort put in.

THE *WORST* PROF I'VE EVER TAKEN A COURSE UNDER. Never take a course under him in case you're eager to learn and want a fair evaluation. Will grade your reports only based on English. Too grumpy and not at all caring. Has too much ego and speaks utter nonsense about the world and politics.

Pointless lectures, where he discusses news articles and political stuff. Homework is so easy even a person with no programming skills can do them. But they are wrapped in a layer of manual labour to make them hard. Quiz questions are vague - Example - what files did you change? Take CS642 with swift instead, its better and much more helpful.

Lectures were a waste of time with him telling stories of who got hacked, various political ramblings, and complaints about industry security. Hopefully the university decides against offering this course again. Also deducted 5% of my grade on class participation despite going to every lecture.

The class is not structured in a way that inviting to learn. I was really interested in topic itself, but quickly turned away by the poor teaching. The lecture is a waste of time. Some quiz are not related to homework at all.

This is the worst class I took in UW Madison. The material is not well prepared. The class has not exam but the small tests are graded tough. The lecture is mandatory but completely useless . You will need to figure out homework by yourself most of the time. The video lecture is hard to follow because of the volume and accent.
When asked if I could cover up my missed quiz somehow, he told me I could drop the class. Extremely rude guy, try to avoid.

The lectures were really interesting and really connected the material to the history and people. (Kind of unusual for a CS class.) Quizzes every week were kind of tiring, but kept me on my toes. The weekly challenge probs helped. Programming assignments made sense and I learned a lot about how an OS works.

What a terrible professor. He'll waste your time with group projects that have little to do with the material. For someone who smugly blames his instructional shortcomings on the fact that you don't always have good information in the real world, he'd rather hold back and surprise you on the weekly quizzes than prepare you for it. Skip this prof!
This guy is rude and comes off as having no respect for students. It is unfortunate for those who desire role models in the faculty.

Bart is an interesting guy. He comes off a bit abrasive at first but is really very nice and helpful. If you're constantly late or say stupid things, he absolutely WILL call you out on it, as you deserve. 736 is not much work other than reading and a project, but if you can't participate in class, he will ramp things up quickly.

I've taken Bart for both OS, CS537 and now Advanced OS, CS736. Both have been reasonable and of the two semester I have had him, his class has been one of my favorites and most interesting. He is a nice guy, gives lots of anecdotes to make things interesting and he doesn't believe in tests. Talk periodically in class and you will get an 'A'.
If you're not a fan of condescending professors, you'll have a hard time liking Bart.

Between Bart and Ramsey, if you're looking for a easier class with less work, I'd choose Bart. He's a good lecturer and his stories are interesting. The class consists of weekly quizzes ,programs and an optional final. Quizzes are reasonable and the programs aren't overwhelming either. Not a lot of work for a 500 level class.

This was a difficult class and Miller expected a lot from us. But I really like his real world examples and I think that I learned a lot.  I know from my internship last summer that I can really use what I learned. (He had some substitutes because he traveled, but they were pretty good.)

He's condescending attitude and arrogance towards his students puts him at one of the lower half of the professors in this school. Despite his quality of understanding the CS material, his dogmatic and saucy personality in general makes him socially incapable. He belongs in a lab and his quality as a professor is questionable.

Knows his stuff, and is very passionate.  Talking to him one-on-one is difficult as he is very condescending and tends to lecture in personal conversation.  He is overly strict about being on time and coming to class (he can tell if you haven't been), though you won't be docked for it.

Bart comes across as kind of a tough guy and definitely likes things done his way.  He is rather dogmatic, but really knows his stuff.  Extremely helpful if you meet him outside of class and his lectures have a good amount of humor.  Do all the work assigned, come to lecure and you'll get a good grade.
